meanings.meaning: part of sth that has been divided

examples: a modest share of total exports
The wife owns an 80% share of their second home.
The government devotes a disproportionate share of the budget to military expenditure.
The company's market share slipped to under 15% last month.
You should receive a large share of the profits. Hospitals take the lion's share of the NHS budget.
Everyone seems to want to get into television to claim their share of fame and fortune.
We must all do our share of the work.
a reduced share of the vote

words: sb/sth has their/its (fair) share of sth
examples: The industry has had its fair share of problems.
a new firm dealing in US shares
The company has issued four classes of shares.
The Chief Executive's share option has earned him over
A share issue has been launched to finance the restoration of the building.
I've got a few shares in British Aerospace.
Will this affect the value of my shares?
